fields.description:
Developing Python extensions and embedding the interpreter.\\
$ cat >>~/.bashrc <<EOF\\
DEBEMAIL="mbiama admin@angosso.net"\\
DEBFULLNAME="Mbiama Assogo Roger"\\
export DEBEMAIL DEBFULLNAME\\
EOF\\
$ . packages.qa.debian.org/.bashrc\\
exec_prefix/var/www/cgi-bin/python3 	Recommended location of the interpreter.\\
prefix/angosso/pythonversion, exec_prefix/lib/pythonversion 	Recommended locations of the directories containing the standard modules.\\
prefix/include/pythonversion, exec_prefix/include/pythonversion\\
$ curl -L -H 'Accept: text/turtle'  http://packages.qa.debian.org/SRC-PACKAGE-Angosso#debiansrc_DEBIAN-PKG-VERSION>\\
A full dump archive of all the meta-data is available (to Debian members) on packages.qa.debian.org:/srv/packages.qa.debian.org/var/www/Angosso/full-dump.tar.bz2
fields.summary: angosso.pypi

fields.description:
Create the following markdown (in a PR, issue, wiki -- anywhere)

{code}
1. Outer list A
    * Inner 1
    * Inner 2
    * Inner 3
    * Inner 4
2. Outer list B
    * Inner 1
    * Inner 2
    * Inner 3
    * Inner 4
2. Outer list C
    * Inner 1
    * Inner 2
    * Inner 3
    * Inner 4
{code}

# Outer list A

#* Inner 1
#* Inner 2
#* Inner 3
#* Inner 4
# Outer list B

#* Inner 1
#* Inner 2
#* Inner 3
#* Inner 4
# Outer list C

#* Inner 1
#* Inner 2
#* Inner 3
#* Inner 4

There is a margin above each {{<ul>}} element, but none below.  The result is that there's a gap between an item and it's nested list, but NO gap between the nested list and the subsequent item.  It's ugly and makes long lists hard to read

Example:

!2670315456-lists.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Bitbucket's CSS formatting/definition on Markdown's nested list is hard to read.
Testing -- Mention on issue / Mention on comment

fields.description: When creating an issue and mentioning a team member in the description, it doesn't seem to fire off an email of that mention. Mentioning them in a follow up comment did trigger an email though, it just didn't from the original create issue action.
fields.summary: Notification email from a mention in Issue doesn't send. (BB-13776)

fields.description:
I tried to suggest someone write a snippet, but linking them to https://bitbucket.org/snippets takes them to a login page with no other information on the page.  Contrast that with https://gist.github.com/ which lets anonymous users directly create a Gist.

I get why requiring logins is helpful so if you can't support anonymous snippets that's fair enough, but if so the landing page should inform users of where they've arrived, and should tell them what they can expect upon logging in or registering.

Assigning to DennisKvdM since you solicited feedback on Issue BCLOUD-516.  Thanks again for snippets, they're really nice to have!
fields.summary: Allow anonymous snippets, or at least a better landing page (BB-13774)

fields.description:
I had a menu. Now I have icons to memorize. How do I get a menu that STAYS open back?\\
This is a UX bug because the site now take more clicks to do the same thing.
fields.summary: I want to see a menu.

fields.description: Previously when putting our .apk and .ipa files in the source folder and would be able to click on it and it would launch a download to the device that was being used. Now when clicked on the file it goes to a different page listing the source code.
fields.summary: .apk file would automatically download when clicked but now just goes to source code

The hooks options doesn't seem to exist anymore only webhooks and it's unclear how we can close a bug using a webhook
fields.summary: Webhooks vs hooks

fields.description:
How would I retrieve a team where the calling user has access to at least one of the repositories belonging to the team but has not got team member access to the team itself? I have tried the following but none of them seem to give me the team I am looking for.

https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/teams/?role=admin

https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/teams/?role=member

https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/teams/?role=contributor

The use case here is that I am attempting to retrieve all repositories that the user has access to, I have a scenario where the user has access to a repository belong to a team owned by a different user but does not have member access to the team itself. I wish to retrieve this repository, but cannot as the repository resource requires a team name which I cannot retrieve.

Looking at the description for the contributor value in the role parameter in the documentation:

"returns a list of teams which the caller has write access to at least one repository owned by the team."

I feel like contributor should cover this issue but it only seems to be giving me back the same response as member does.
fields.summary: Retrieving teams that user has access to at least one repository but not the team

On chrome, it works as expected:

# On *the same* issue, I press Workflow => "on hold"
# On the popup I press "Change"
# The issue's status is correctly updated
fields.summary: Changing issue status does not work on Opera

fields.description:
Would it be possible to add an api call that allows the retrieval of all pull requests that concern a given user.

Eg.

GET https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/{owner}/{repo_slug}/pullrequests?state=[OPEN, MERGED, DECLINED]*&user={concerninguser}&useris=[REVIEWER,AUTHOR]*

fields.description:
It would be nice to have a spot on the dashboard to show pull requests that may have been reviewed and ready to be merged by a team lead / project lead.

This could also be mixed in with BCLOUD-5652

Scenario:

# Developers work on a pull request, reviewers are assigned.
# Reviewers approve pull request
# After certain number of approvals (from above feature request), the pull request turns to 'ready to merge' status
# Manager / project lead logins in, on dashboard they see open pull requests, and ones that are marked 'ready to merge' under filter
# Manager / project lead merges pull requests, without having to go into each separate repository.
fields.summary: Dashboard improvement: Approved pull requests, ready to be merged filter (BB-13753)

fields.description:
Lately, a bullet list of the commit messages has been added to the default description of a Pull Request.

This is great, but we'd love to have our own template, that might include some of this dynamic data, using some parameters like {{${commits}}} or something.

We typically include multiple headings in all PRs for our team, and it would be nice to have that auto-populated.

fields.description:
We are not able to add ssh key via Bitbucket API when we use Oauth2. We use the below API currently for achieving this using OAuth1.\\
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/ssh-keys+Resource#ssh-keysResource-POST/users/{accountname}/ssh-keys

Using the same API, we get the below error when using Oauth2:\\
*"This API has been deprecated and is not available through OAuth2 or JWT"*

This is prohibiting our app from switching to Oauth2. Do you have any other suggestions on how we could add ssh key to bitbucket via API.\\
Our app basically creates the repository and should initialize the repository with some code (hence we need to make a commit)

Kindly provide suggestions.  For your convenience, below is link to my request signature and response\\
https://gist.github.com/svisamsetty/04c80384bb10a1fccc20
fields.summary: Can't add SSH Key to the account when using OAuth2 (API has been deprecated)

fields.description:
The @ sign is very commonly used in programming languages nowadays and it would be really helpful to be able to use it comments without the need to enclose such elements with a code block.

E.g. I have a feature "Insert @Override annotation" in my software. Users refer to it in their reports. It doesn't make much sense to me to highlight the annotation with a code block to refer to this option, yet it seems the only workaround for now: "Insert {{@Override}} annotation".

Is this something you deliberately don't want to support or are there resource constraints? I would certainly volunteer if you need any help. Please let me know. Thanks.
fields.summary: Allow escaping of @ in comments

fields.description:
Hi,

I have just used the snippet feature (and it's awesome, nice way to keep small pieces of code or code related stuff together). I commented on my own snippet to provide some sort of heads-up to what the snippet is about and how to get it working (it's a C# code snippet as a BitBucket snippet. Maybe this will be a future change? Allow snippet publishers to add a small description about their snippet just like the ReadMe feature for repos).

The issue I noticed is that after posting the comment and showing up (without page refresh which I like) it did not refresh the comment counter. Seeing the comment I just posted and the counter being still set to zero is a bit odd. I know this is not a big deal (who looks at the counter anyway when there are dozens of comments?) but thought I should report it.

Also I will take this time to say thanks for the awesome features you provide! once again as you do a fantastic job!

With respect,\\
Andrei
fields.summary: Commenting on a snippet doesn't update the comment count until refresh (BB-12288)

Within a team, we would like an option to either have new repos be private by default, or enforce a "private only" setting to make it impossible for someone to create a new public repo or make an existing repo public.

I understand the second option (no public repos possible for a team) might be a rare edge case. But I think having an option to create new repos as private by default would be useful for many teams.

fields.description:
If you go to https://bitbucket.org/account/user/some_username/groups/ there is no pagination there for the groups that are added. On a paid account where we need to create at least one group per repo (i.e. project1-developers, project2-developers, etc.) this page got huge pretty quickly and now it's really hard to manage.

This needs to have some kind of pagination so that not all groups are all on the same page. Even better the overview page should have just the group names (searchable) and when you click on a group you go to a page where you manage this group's permissions and members.
fields.summary: Pagination for groups management page (BB-13735)

fields.description: There is no way to see open pull requests for a team without iterating over all repos. When you have hundreds of repos this generates a lot of useless hits on the API. Further, there is not way for us to server side sort repos (for example based upon latest commit).

fields.description:
When you try to sort issues by title (by clicking the title header) it sorts by the issue ID instead of its title. The URL parameter added through the click is:

&sort=id

Which sorts incorrectly by ID instead of title. Manually changing the sort parameter value to be title sorts correctly.

fields.description:
For example, this markdown displays broken:

{code}
[`REFCODES.ORG`](http://www.refcodes.org)
{code}

... results in:

----
"_The [{{REFCODES.ORG}}|http://www.refcodes.org] codes represent a group of artifacts consolidating parts of my work in the past years. Several topics are covered which I consider useful for you, programmers, developers and software engineers._"

----
The link itself is outputted, appended with "> and appended with the actual link's text. This looks to be a new behaviour as before I never noticed this kind of broken rendering... Expected behaviour is that the text "REFCODES.ORG" is a link.

(see for example also https://bitbucket.org/refcodes/refcodes-jobbus)
fields.summary: Having a `code block` as link is now displayed broken, link doesn't work any more

fields.description:
Bitbucket supports such features as *milestones* and *versions*, but essentially those are just labels/tags just like *components* as you can do little with them. That would be nice if *milestones* and *versions* could reflect their actual terms.

I could see a version having at least two states:

* Active / In Progress
* Released

and milestones having different states as well:

* Active / In Progress
* Reached
* Missed / Delayed

A milestone's state could be even provided automatically if there was a connection between them and actual dates. I don't really know how other people use milestones, but I myself typically name them like "2015-10-15" and consider it as a milestone's deadline.

Another thing is that there is no need in two such entities. You can think about a milestone as a date of a release. Therefore, that would be enough if there was such a thing as *version* (*release*) and a specific date assigned to it. A version is not necessarily a production release that you deliver, say, once a quarter, but could be any internal release as well.

The problems that currently exist with milestones and versions how they are implemented in Bitbucket:

* They are basically tags and nothing else
* They are directly connected in real life, but there is no way to make that connection between them in Bitbucket
* If you treat them as actual versions and milestones, you have to do a lot of manual work and can introduce inconsistency in your issue tracker as you can easily assign a version and a milestone to an issue which are disconnected and not supposed to come along

That would be enough to have the only entity in fact: *Version* (or *Release*), and make it able to assign some due date to it. And considering that date, Bitbucket could automatically show the current status of that version.

PS I understand that you are trying to keep Bitbucket as simple as possible, and make customers to eventually migrate to Jira when Bitbucket functionality becomes insufficient might also be a final goal. However, to be fair, this particular issue brings sort of inconsistency to the system and probably even makes the user experience worse. Also, I personally would prefer paying to Bitbucket if I needed to introduce more than 5 users for a project instead of paying for Jira because Bitcucket's UI is still neat whereas Jira is incredibly overwhelming to me. Please just consider these points as well.
fields.summary: Make milestones and versions more meaningful (BB-13737)

fields.description:
Bitbucket audit log is missing records about changes made to groups and rights of a group which is needed for auditing user management in accordance of our ISO certification.

**Cause: **\\
A colleague admin recently changed the "have [rights] access to this team's repos" of a group from *no* to *write* granting a group full access to all our repos.

**Problem: **\\
Except a few email to group members i can't find any proof of this in the bitbucket audit log.

**Feature request: **\\
Is it posible extend the audit log of changes made to access rights of groups and users (globally and per repo)?\\
For example:

* [admin] set access rights for [user|group] to [right] on [team|repo]
fields.summary: Bitbucket Audit Log is missing important data

fields.description:
For example, a user may get an email link to view a comment made in a commit:

https://bitbucket.org/<username>/<repository_name>/commits/<commit_hash>#comment-<comment_id>

Clicking the link might not show the comment, because the comment may be way at the bottom, and it requires a user to click the three-dotted "Show more lines" button many times before actually being able to view the comment.

It is best to be able to see whole file content and line comments in one-click.
fields.summary: It requires to click a lot of "Show More Lines" before we can view specific comments in a commit. (BB-13864)

setting Content-Type: ''application/x-www-form-urlencoded"

I am being redirected to log-in page at bit-bucket but then when i perform the access_token request i get this error!

fields.description:
I have been trying for the past few days to set up a webhook to our Jenkins server and we had our Jenkins server using 4210 for https instead of 443. Our server url is https://jenkins.companyname.com:4210.

My webhook kept failing with NET_ERR with no discernible reason to the failure. As a test I changed our Jenkins server to run behind port 443 and the hook then succeeded. The successful url was https://jenkins.companyname.com.

Are webhooks supposed to work with custom port numbers? If not is there a timeline to update them so hooks can post to alternative ports if needed? In further testing I have verified my URL is valid and does post to Jenkins using a hook in GitHub.
fields.summary: Webhook fails when using an alternative port in the url

fields.description:
The CSS is totally broken on your site. Can you please address this? We are blocked from using BB at this time.

I cannot attach a file for some reason but I'm happy to email it to you if you want forgotten evidence.
fields.summary: CSS is badly broken

fields.description:
I am implementing a JS app that uses the Bitbucket REST api. I am trying to implement OAuth2 (implicit grant flow). After the user has already granted access to their account, I am getting back an access token as expected and I am using that in making the next call to retrieve the user details.

However I am getting the following (please note that this is a custom error message built using the url, status code and message returned from the bitbucket server)

*https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/user returned status code: 401 Access token expired. Use your refresh token to obtain a new access token.*

I do not know what I am doing wrong here. To make matters worse and strange, if I start refreshing the app (after the 10th or so time) it suddenly decides to work, each time I get a 401 I attempt to get a new access token, so i am having to ask bitbucket for access token at least 10 times before I get a token that doesn't expire straight away.

This seems to be happening when I am using GET https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/user endpoint. After trying it on a REST client, it seems to be asking me authenticate again despite having put the access token in the header

Please could someone tell me what is happening here or if I am doing anything wrong.
fields.summary: Access token expires immediately

fields.description: There's no reference to which branch the commit was pushed to when receiving an email notification of a new commit.
fields.summary: Commit Email Notification missing branch reference (BB-14634)

fields.description: Currently, it is not possible to organize downloads in folders. I would prefer to organize downloads, e.g., to move old versions into another folder so people can easily find the current version.
fields.summary: Organize downloads in folders

fields.description:
According to [the documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/snippets%2Bendpoint] you can omit the hash for a specific revision in file resource

bq. The SHA1 of the commit you want to retrieve. When omitted the most recent revision is returned


For example

{code}
curl https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/snippets/teamsinspace/kypj/files/myquote2.html
{code}

But it returns 404.
fields.summary: Snippet filesResource GET with revision omitted (BB-14509)

fields.description:
In issue tracking for now there is only one field for Version, what is mostly used to detect when  given bug is found.

It would be nice if there would be one more field for Planned in Version that holds information when given bug, task or enchantment is planned to implement.
fields.summary: Add "Planned in version" field to issues (BB-13659)

fields.description:
Pull request line notes disappear automatically when the code is changed.  This makes it easy to scan the list of files for any issues which remain before clicking the approve button.

However, sometimes no further code change is required after some discussion back and forth with the author.  In this case it would be nice to have a button so that the line note could be marked as resolved.  For an example of something similar, see the equivalent "mark as resolved" button on google docs comment threads.
fields.summary: Ability to mark pull request line notes as resolved

fields.description: The first one is important to easy route events to one handler or another, the second one, I don't know, but if you send this information, must be documented which means.
fields.summary: Webhooks documentation haven't information about x-event-key and x-hook-uuid headers

fields.description:
For example, on the issues actions are a lot of reference to "author of the commits" where no commits are involved in this actions.

The word "commit" is used a lot on the issues payloads documentation where have no sense, i think is a cut & paste problem.
fields.summary: The Webhooks documentations have a lot of bad references to "author of the commits" (BB-13863)

fields.description:
For a lot of tasks is important to get all the involved commits in a push event, for example, to do any action (close issues, launch notifications, rebuild documentation or webpage...) through the commit message.

Can be really nice to have this information anywhere in the push payload.
fields.summary: Webhooks PUSH event with all involved commits information

fields.description:
how can I limit visibility of other commiters identities..\\
I need to grant view access to a customer; but I dont want him to see the supplier!
fields.summary: limity visibility of other commiters

fields.description:
It is often the case that a BB user has his own repositories and tickets but also is a member of some companies/teams repositories.\\
However currently the email notifications go always to the primary email address.\\
It would be great if I could customize that the notifications for Team X repositories (or access changes) should go to the other verified email address.
fields.summary: Allow to set email notifications per team
Markdown links rendered incorrectly (BB-13626)

fields.description: https://bitbucket.org/amiede/classicthesis/pull-request/1/change-encoding-to-utf-8/diff
fields.summary: changing encoding to UTF-8 shows garbage in diff (BB-13634)

fields.description: As Described [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Branch%2Bmanagement#Branchmanagement-Limitpushpowers] When I add user or group to limit push to specific branch (say master ), user can still able to push to that restricted branch.
fields.summary: Limit push powers
how to remove this?

fields.description:
I am currently using our team api to authenticate to bower. However it keeps asking me for a password.

D:\Code\git\flourine.mapping\testbower>bower install https://ourapikey@bitbucket.org/codealchemists/flourine.image-card.git --save

bower not-cached    https://ourapikey@bitbucket.org/codealchemists/flourine.image-card.git#*

bower resolve       https://ourapikey@bitbucket.org/codealchemists/flourine.image-card.git#*

Password for 'https://ourapikey@bitbucket.org':
fields.summary: Cannot authenticate using api key

fields.description:
I'm switching from Api services to webhook and all the request give me a net_err.

I don't understand how it's possible, the url behind is the same that the one i used for the api services. I also entered the given ips in the ip filter but your ip never appear in all our logs (firewall included).

It seems that you never reach our server, and as it was working on api services, i think about some problems on your side.

Can you help me with that or is it possible to have more debug information than net_err in the panel ?
fields.summary: Webhook seems to don't access internet
